newsitem.title: USA: Columbia/HCA probed on referrals, rewards - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Columbia/HCA probed on referrals, rewards - WSJ.

text.p: Federal investigators in Texas were examing how Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp rewarded doctors which joined its network and its method of patient referrals, the Wall Street Journal said in Wednesday's electronic edition.
Federal agents have shown an interest in interviewing those who brought lawsuits against Columbia/HCA of Nashville, Tenn. over patient referral practices, the paper said.
It cited people who had been interviewed by federal agents as its sources.
Columbia/HCA was not immediately available to comment.
The company said in the paper it still had not been notified as to the nature of the investigation.
On March 19, it said its El Paso, Texas operations were served with search warrants in connection with a federal investigation.
